items.title: Here’s the tech that could turn millions of Zigbee light bulbs into motion sensors with a single update
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- New ambient sensing technology called [Sensify](https://www.ivani.com/tech-bytes-news/zigbee-and-wireless-network-sensing) can turn mains-powered Zigbee devices into motion sensors.
- Sensify requires just a firmware update, potentially affecting tens of millions of devices already in homes.
- Philips Hue could be among the first to utilize this technology, as speculations have been ongoing regarding Zigbee sensing capabilities.
- Sensify works by detecting disturbances in radio frequencies, needing at least three devices for effective motion detection.
- The technology aims to enhance smart home automation, offering advantages in cost and scalability without needing extra hardware.

items.title: Google will let you control your Chromebook with your face
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Google announces new classroom and accessibility features for ChromeOS, including face control support for Chromebooks aimed at users with motor impairments.
- This feature, previously introduced in December, is now rolling out to compatible devices (recommended 8GB RAM).
- Google is set to launch over 20 new Chromebook models in 2025, including a new 14-inch Lenovo Chromebook Plus 2-in-1.
- Additional classroom tools allow teachers to control students’ screens and help in real-time learning environments, enhancing engagement and interaction.

items.title: Here’s what Bambu will — and won’t — promise after its controversial 3D printer update
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Bambu Lab's recent firmware update introduces a new proprietary authentication mechanism, restricting third-party software access.
- Users can still print via SD card or Bambu's cloud service, but remote control via third-party slicers requires a new app, Bambu Connect.
- Bambu has committed to never requiring a subscription to control current printers or to restrict third-party filament usage.
- A Developer Mode will be introduced, allowing local access without the new authentication, albeit with potential limitations.
- Concerns arise about Bambu’s security, especially after hackers extracted sensitive data from their new app.
- Bambu has been criticized for censorship and misleading statements about third-party collaborations.

items.title: Trump pardons Silk Road operator Ross Ulbricht
items.author: Sarah Jeong
items.summary:
- On Tuesday, President Donald Trump issued a pardon to Ross Ulbricht, operator of the Silk Road marketplace.
- Ulbricht had been serving a life sentence since 2015 for multiple charges including narcotics distribution.
- The Silk Road was known for illicit trade including drugs and forged documents and was an early commercial use of Bitcoin.
- Supporters argue Ulbricht's sentence was excessively harsh compared to similar offenders who received lighter sentences.
- The judge considered deaths linked to drug purchases through the Silk Road in sentencing Ulbricht.
- Ulbricht maintained his innocence, and evidence against him included files from his laptop seized by law enforcement.

items.title: Trump says he’s open to Musk or Ellison buying TikTok
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- President Trump expressed openness to Elon Musk or Larry Ellison buying TikTok.
- Trump suggested a deal where the buyer gives half of the ownership to the U.S. for regulatory approval.
- Legal experts are skeptical about the feasibility of operating TikTok under U.S. law without violating the First Amendment.
- Trump signed an executive order delaying enforcement of a forced divestiture bill for 75 days, but offers limited legal protection for companies like Oracle.
- Current offers for TikTok include bids from Project Liberty and content creator MrBeast.

items.title: Microsoft Allows OpenAI Access to Competitors' Compute Power
items.author: Kylie Robison
items.summary:
- Microsoft and OpenAI announced a revised partnership allowing OpenAI to access competitors' computing resources.
- The new agreement modifies previous exclusivity, with Microsoft retaining a right of first refusal.
- Microsoft's exclusive rights to OpenAI's tech for products like Copilot remain in place, and OpenAI's API stays exclusive to Azure.
- This change comes after OpenAI expressed concerns over computing capacity lagging behind its needs.
- The companies have faced challenges, including relationship strains following leadership changes at OpenAI.

items.title: OpenAI and Softbank are starting a $500 billion AI data center company
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Announcement of The Stargate Project by Masayoshi Son, Sam Altman, and Larry Ellison with Donald Trump.
- $500 billion investment for new AI infrastructure by OpenAI, Softbank, and Oracle over the next four years.
- Initial tech partners include Arm, Microsoft, NVIDIA, Oracle, and OpenAI, with development starting in Texas.
- Microsoft and OpenAI's partnership update with a new, large Azure commitment and change in exclusive arrangement.

items.title: Meta’s next smart glasses may be with Oakley
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Meta is reportedly launching new Oakley-branded smart glasses, called "Supernova 2", potentially later this year.
- These glasses will shift the camera to the center of the frame, targeting cyclists and outdoor athletes.
- Oakley is under the same parent company as Ray-Ban, and these glasses may have features appealing to athletes, unlike the current Ray-Ban Meta glasses.
- Meta is also set to launch a more advanced version of Ray-Ban glasses with display capabilities for notifications and apps.

items.title: Sonic 4 comes to theaters in March 2027
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- The fourth Sonic movie will be released on March 19, 2027, according to Variety.
- The film follows the successful release of Sonic the Hedgehog 3 in December 2024.
- Notable cast members include Jim Carrey as Dr. Robotnik, Idris Elba as Knuckles, and Keanu Reeves as Shadow.
- A post-credits scene in Sonic 3 hints at potential new characters in Sonic 4.
- Sonic 4 will launch after the Super Mario Bros. Movie sequel, which premieres on April 3, 2026.

items.title: Netflix is raising prices again, as the standard plan goes up to $17.99
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Netflix announced a price increase across most plans in the US, Canada, Portugal, and Argentina.
- The ad-supported tier increases from $6.99 to $7.99, standard ad-free from $15.49 to $17.99, and premium from $22.99 to $24.99, effective during the next billing cycle.
- Netflix added 19 million new subscribers in a single quarter, bringing the total to 300 million, but will only announce major subscriber milestones starting in Q1 2025.
- The company aims for growth, projecting less than 10% of TV viewing in available countries.
- Netflix is launching a new Extra Member with Ads plan for ad-supported users to add someone outside their household for an additional cost.
- The streaming service is ramping up its live content strategy, focusing on special event programming despite some technical challenges.

items.title: The Switch 2 has a new trigger for disconnecting Joy-Con controllers
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- A video on [Nintendo’s Switch 2 website](https://www.nintendo.com/successor/en-us/index.html) demonstrates the new trigger on Joy-Con controllers that disconnect them from the console.
- The trigger mechanism involves pressing down and then releasing a cylinder to help eject the Joy-Con.
- The design is reminiscent of a 3D-printed mockup shown by accessories-maker Genki at [CES 2025](https://www.theverge.com/2025/1/8/24339396/nintendo-switch-2-genki-ces-2025).

items.title: Apple Intelligence is enabled by default in iOS 18.3
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
[Apple Intelligence will be switched on by default in iOS 18.3, iPadOS 18.3, and macOS 15.3.](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/ios-ipados-release-notes/ios-ipados-18_3-release-notes#New-Features)
[Only devices supporting Apple Intelligence, like iPhone 15 Pro or Macs with M1 chip, will have this feature enabled.](https://9to5mac.com/2025/01/21/ios-18-3-automatically-enables-apple-intelligence-requires-opt-out-to-disable/)
[Users can disable Apple Intelligence by navigating to the settings after the update.](https://www.theverge.com/2025/1/21/24348850/apple-intelligence-ai-default-setting-ios-18-3)

items.title: Microsoft’s Steam-like browser overlay is now available on Windows 11
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft is launching a new in-game browser overlay for Windows 11 called Game Assist, after months of beta testing.
- The overlay appears in the Game Bar and is designed to offer tips and guides for games being played.
- Users can enable the feature by going into Microsoft Edge settings and installing the Game Assist widget.
- The feature currently supports popular games like *Indiana Jones and the Great Circle*, *Marvel Rivals*, and *Dragon Age: The Veilguard*, with plans to expand its game support in the future.
- Game Assist utilizes cookies, autofill, and favorites from the main Microsoft Edge browser, and supports extensions such as ad blockers.

items.title: ACLU and 18 states sue Trump over his attempt to repeal birthright citizenship
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
items.summary:
- President Trump issued an executive order aimed at repealing birthright citizenship, impacting over 11 million undocumented immigrants and 580,000 H1-B visa holders.
- The order claims to reinterpret the 14th Amendment to deny citizenship to children of undocumented immigrants and certain visa holders.
- The ACLU and 18 states have filed lawsuits challenging the order in federal courts, arguing it is unconstitutional and discriminatory.

items.title: How to mirror your iPhone screen on macOS
items.author: David Nield
items.summary:
- Apple’s Continuity feature allows iPhone screen mirroring on macOS with devices meeting certain requirements.
- Requires iPhone with iOS 18 or later and Mac with Apple silicon or T2 chip running macOS Sequoia 15 or higher, both signed into the same Apple account with two-factor authentication.
- Bluetooth and Wi-Fi must be enabled on both devices, and iPhone needs to be locked and close to the Mac.
- The feature allows interaction with apps on the iPhone via the Mac, including audio playback through Mac speakers.
- Users can manage iPhone notifications on their Mac and drag/drop files between devices.
- There are keyboard shortcuts for quick navigation and a setting to manage future connections.

items.title: Balatro has sold over 1 million copies since December
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Balatro has sold 5 million copies within its first year of launch.
- The game received a significant sales boost of 1.5 million units after its feature at The Game Awards.
- Balatro has been nominated for multiple awards and won best indie, best debut indie, and best mobile categories.
- Developed by a single person in two years, it has garnered a reputation as a highly engaging poker roguelike game.
- A major gameplay-focused update is hinted to be released in 2025 after mainly cosmetic updates since launch.

items.title: Microsoft will automatically keep you signed in to your account starting in February
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Starting in February, Microsoft accounts will automatically stay signed in unless the user signs out or uses private browsing.
- This change affects users on public computers, emphasizing the need to sign out after use.
- Users can force log out their accounts on all devices if they forget to sign out.
- This update follows the addition of passkey support for Microsoft accounts introduced months prior.

items.title: Korg’s first record players are designed for DJs, audiophiles, and archivists
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Korg announced a new collection of portable record players: Handytraxx Play, Handytraxx Tube, and Handytraxx 1bit.
- Handytraxx Play ($399) is designed for DJs with features like a built-in crossfader and two 2.5-watt speakers.
- Handytraxx Tube ($799) includes an aluminum die-cast platter and Korg’s Nutube technology for enhanced sound quality.
- Limited edition Handytraxx Tube J ($1,199) features upgraded cartridge.
- Handytraxx 1bit ($999) digitizes vinyl to DSD format for high-quality archiving.
- Development involved Toshihide Nakama, former Vestax president, who passed in 2023.

items.title: Volvo announces pricing for delayed EX30 compact SUV
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- The Volvo EX30 arrives in the US with a starting price of $34,950 postponed to 2025 due to tariffs on vehicles built in China.
- The EX30 Twin Motor Performance variant will start at $44,900, with the Ultra package priced at $46,600.
- Over 100,000 units of the EX30 have been sold in Europe, indicating strong potential demand once available in the US.

items.title: WhatsApp will let you share your status on Instagram and Facebook
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Meta is integrating WhatsApp into its Accounts Center, allowing status sharing across Instagram and Facebook.
- The feature will be available globally over the next few months and requires user opt-in.
- WhatsApp personal data will not be used for targeted ads unless the user links their account to the Accounts Center.
- Messages in WhatsApp will remain end-to-end encrypted.
- Future updates will enable management of features like Meta AI stickers and avatars through Accounts Center.

items.title: The UK government is launching a digital ID mobile app
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- The UK government is launching the GOV.UK Wallet app for digitizing driver's licenses on Android and iOS later this year.
- The app will utilize smartphone security features like facial recognition to protect personal data.
- Veteran cards will be the first supported documents, with mobile driver's licenses piloted in 2025.
- All UK government services are expected to offer digital alternatives by 2027, but physical documents will remain available.
- The app aims to give citizens more control over their data, facilitating easier access to benefits and proving age for purchases.
- A new GOV.UK app will also launch in summer 2025 for accessing government information and completing tasks.
- Future plans include an AI chatbot named “GOV.UK Chat” co-developed by OpenAI for assistance with services and notifications.

items.title: IMDb’s CEO, who founded the site 35 years ago, is stepping down
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- IMDb founder and CEO Col Needham is stepping down after 35 years; he will serve as executive chair.
- COO Nikki Santoro will take over as CEO, having joined IMDb in 2016 and served as COO since 2021.
- Needham started IMDb in 1990 and maintained his role after Amazon acquired it in 1998, overseeing significant updates like IMDbPro.
- As executive chair, Needham will continue to provide strategic guidance and serve as a global ambassador for the company.
- Needham expressed confidence in Santoro’s leadership in guiding IMDb into a new era.

items.title: CapCut is back online in the US
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- CapCut, owned by ByteDance, is now operational in the US following a federal order.
- Users were welcomed back with notices thanking them for their patience.
- This follows President Trump's executive order delaying actions against affected services for 75 days.
- Despite CapCut's online status, it is not available in Apple or Google's app stores.
- Under US law, ByteDance was required to sell the app by January 19 to continue operating, but chose to pursue legal options instead.
- Trump is attempting to negotiate a joint venture for TikTok to avoid a ban, which poses its own legal risks.

items.title: A federal website on reproductive rights has vanished
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- A federal website for reproductive rights, [reproductiverights.gov](http://reproductiverights.gov/), has gone offline following Donald Trump's inauguration.
- The website was launched by the Biden administration in 2022 after the Supreme Court's decision to [overturn Roe v. Wade](https://www.theverge.com/2022/6/24/23169382/roe-wade-overturned-supreme-court-abortion-rights-reproductive-health).
- It provided information on abortion rights and preventative care resources, and a snapshot is available via [Internet Archive](https://web.archive.org/web/20250115014223/https://reproductiverights.gov/).
- Concerns rise among scientists and advocates about potential changes to federal websites under the Trump administration, especially regarding [climate change](https://www.theverge.com/2025/1/18/24346025/data-donald-trump-climate-environment-epa).
- The Department of Health and Human Services has not yet responded to inquiries about the website's disappearance.

items.title: Infinity Nikki’s new season brings the game’s biggest update yet
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
• Infinity Nikki's Firework Season update starts January 23rd, themed around Lunar New Year.
• New content includes outfits, locations, and limited-time quests.
• Developer Infold offers three outfits available for free, and a new premium gacha selection.
• A new area called Firework Isles and a boss encounter named The Dark Bouquet will be introduced.
• The update will include a launch of the game's soundtrack on music platforms.

items.title: Last Day for $50 Credit on Samsung Galaxy Preorders
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Samsung is announcing the Galaxy S25 and other devices on January 22nd at the Unpacked event.
- You can get $50 in credit towards eligible products by signing up on Samsung’s website or app until January 22nd at 1 PM ET.
- The credit cannot be applied directly to the preorder price, but can be used for other Samsung devices and accessories.
- Rumors suggest the Galaxy S25 may include Qi2 wireless charging and other new features.

items.title: Fujifilm’s new hybrid instant camera features its widest lens yet
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Fujifilm announced the Instax Wide Evo Hybrid instant camera, doubling as a smartphone printer.
- Launching in February 2025 at $349.95 with a matching case for $49.99.
- Features a 15.67mm lens, the widest used in any Instax camera, enabling wide-angle images.
- 3.5-inch LCD display for framing shots, no viewfinder.
- Battery can print up to 100 images; microSD card slot for expanded storage.
- Offers 10 lens effects and 10 film effects, with customizable intensity settings.
- Nostalgic film style customizations available, including film strip holes and date/time overlays.
- Functions as a wireless printer via Bluetooth smartphone connection.

items.title: Donald Trump Rescinds Biden-Era Executive Order on AI Safety
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- Donald Trump rescinded a Biden-era executive order on generative AI safety on his first day in office.
- The original Biden order required developers like OpenAI to share safety test results with the government and develop safety standards.
- Trump signed 78 executive orders, including the rescission of the order related to AI safety, as he prioritizes AI development in his administration.
keywords: National Institute of Standards and Technology

items.title: Instagram is reportedly trying to attract TikTok creators with large bonuses
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Instagram is offering creators cash bonuses between $10,000 to $50,000 per month to post Reels exclusively on their platform.
- This initiative aims to attract TikTok creators during TikTok's absence from app stores.
- The bonuses require creators to publish their videos on Instagram before other platforms like TikTok.
- Instagram had launched a Reels bonus program in 2021, but it was later cut in 2023 due to reduced payouts.
- TikTok is facing a chaotic situation in the US due to recent compliance laws, impacting its availability.
- Instagram has made various updates recently to cater to TikTok creators, including new profile formats and extended Reels length to three minutes.
- Some TikTok creators express dissatisfaction with Meta's recent policy changes, which may affect their willingness to switch platforms.

items.title: A24’s Opus blurs the line between fandom and faith in first trailer
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- The trailer for A24's *Opus* explores the spiritual experience of meeting music stars.
- Directed by Mark Anthony Green, the film follows journalist Ariel Ecton (Ayo Edebiri) as she investigates eccentric superstar Alfred Moretti (John Malkovich).
- Moretti emerges after three decades to share music exclusively with select celebrities and invites Ariel to his home.
- The trailer hints at cult-like activities surrounding Moretti, showcasing frantic guests and Ariel's terrified reactions.
- *Opus* is set to be released in theaters on March 14, 2025, and is anticipated as a disturbing thriller.

items.title: How the future of sports streaming died
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Venu Sports aimed to consolidate sports viewing into one platform but faced criticisms regarding cost and competitiveness.
- Despite initial excitement, the service encountered significant challenges leading to its shutdown.
- The Vergecast episode features insights from Jacob Feldman about the origins and demise of Venu, and discusses the implications for the future of sports streaming.

items.title: What to expect at Samsung’s Galaxy S25 event
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Samsung's Galaxy Unpacked event is scheduled for January 22nd at 1PM ET.
- The event will be streamed on YouTube, Samsung's website, and newsroom page.
- Expected announcements include Galaxy S25, S25 Plus, and S25 Ultra with design tweaks.
- The S25 Ultra may feature slightly rounder corners based on leaked renders.
- Galaxy S25 devices will support Qi2 wireless charging, possibly needing a magnetic case for full experience.
- Phones will run One UI 7 based on Android 15, featuring new camera app and HDR content disabling option.
- No Galaxy S25 Slim is expected to launch in the US.
- Potential discussions about the “Project Moohan” VR headset during the event.

items.title: Samsung needs to give us a reason to care about new phones every year
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- The Galaxy S25 series is rumored to be uninspiring and similar to previous models.
- Samsung's launch events no longer feel special; they often repeat previous innovations.
- Hardware innovation is stagnating; software features are becoming the focus.
- Apple's recent launches, like the iPhone 16, also highlight minimal hardware changes.
- Potentially exciting developments include slimmer designs for future models.

items.title: Marvel Snap is back in the US
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Marvel Snap resumes operation in the US after being offline due to a TikTok ban law affecting its ByteDance-owned publisher.
- Developer Second Dinner plans to bring more services in-house and partner with a new publisher to prevent future disruptions.
- The game is not yet available on Apple’s App Store or Google Play, but is still live on Steam.
- TikTok service was restored after a brief period, although it remains missing from app stores.
- An executive order by President Trump delays enforcement of the law banning ByteDance apps for 75 days.

items.title: Trump signs executive order to reverse Biden’s electric vehicle policies
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- President Trump signed an executive order to eliminate Biden’s electric vehicle policies, which he called a “mandate”.
- He intends to weaken tailpipe emission standards, impacting environmental protections.
- The orders aim to halt funding for EV charging through the Inflation Reduction Act and pause other financial disbursements related to EV initiatives.
- Trump plans to review regulations that may burden domestic energy development, particularly impacting emissions standards.
- There is no existing EV mandate, but Trump targets regulations incentivizing EV sales to slashing greenhouse gas emissions.
- The auto industry has invested heavily in EV development, with EV sales increasing by 7.3% in 2024.
- Trump is also looking to ramp up mining for non-fuel minerals, potentially linked to interests in Greenland’s resources.
- Transportation contributes about 28% of US greenhouse gas emissions, which are linked to climate change.

items.title: Trump Signs Order to Delay TikTok Ban for 75 Days
items.author: Adi Robertson
items.summary:
- President Trump issued an executive order directing the DOJ not to enforce TikTok’s required divestment from ByteDance for 75 days.
- The order aims to provide time for determining the appropriate course regarding TikTok and prevents penalties against American companies involved with it.
- Trump’s executive order follows a bipartisan law effective January 19, 2025, which could impose heavy penalties for noncompliance.
- Legal ambiguity exists regarding the legality of pausing the ban as no sale to a non-foreign adversary has been announced.
- Major companies may still avoid reinstating TikTok due to significant potential legal penalties, despite Trump’s assurances.

items.title: Donald Trump pulls US out of Paris climate agreement
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- Donald Trump signed an executive order to exit the [Paris climate agreement](https://unfccc.int/process-and-meetings/the-paris-agreement) for the second time during his presidency.
- The Paris accord, adopted in 2015, aimed to limit global temperature rise and was joined by nearly 200 countries.
- The US will now be among the only countries, including Iran, Libya, and Yemen, not participating in the agreement.
- The withdrawal is expected to take one year from notification to the UN to be finalized.
- Environmental advocates criticize the move as a defiance of scientific consensus regarding climate change.

items.title: Brendan Carr is officially in charge of the FCC
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Brendan Carr officially appointed as chair of the FCC, with plans to set agency agenda and implement regulations affecting tech and media industries.
- Priorities include jobs and growth through spectrum, infrastructure, and the space economy, referencing his involvement in Project 2025.
- Proposed actions involve limiting Section 230 immunity for tech companies, supporting rural broadband funding, and expediting satellite launch approvals.
- Carr addresses national security concerns related to TikTok, amidst conflicting views from Trump on the app's risks.
- He may revoke spectrum licenses based on hosting decisions, a contentious issue highlighted during Kamala Harris's appearance on SNL.
- Approval of measures requires a third Republican vote; Trump has nominated Mark Meador for a seat on the commission.

items.title: Vivek Ramaswamy steps down from DOGE
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Vivek Ramaswamy steps down from co-leading DOGE (Department of Government Efficiency).
- He plans to run for Ohio governor, necessitating his departure from DOGE.
- Ramaswamy's exit follows internal friction and dissatisfaction with his participation alongside Elon Musk.

items.title: Dynasty Warriors: Origins is a refreshing take on the legendary series
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Developed by Koei-Tecmo’s Omega Force, this is the tenth game in the Dynasty Warriors series.
- The game adapts the Chinese historical novel Romance of the Three Kingdoms and introduces a single protagonist known as the Wanderer.
- Combat includes light and heavy attacks, skills unlocked through use, and mechanics that require strategic play to defeat powerful enemy generals.
- Battles take place on large maps with objectives such as defeating enemy leaders and saving allied generals, enhancing the feeling of heroism.
- Released on PlayStation, Xbox, and PC.

items.title: Fujifilm’s new stabilized binoculars deliver even more zoom
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Fujifilm launched two models in the Techno-Stabi line: TS-L2040 (20x zoom) and TS-L1640 (16x zoom).
- Both models will be available starting January 31, 2025, priced at $1,299.95 and $1,199.95, respectively.
- New binoculars are smaller and lighter than previous models, with improved waterproofing and stabilization features.
- They use AAA batteries, offering up to 30 hours of stabilization and an auto power-off feature after 60 minutes.
- Both models have 40mm objective lenses to improve light intake and brightness.

items.title: Trump declared a ‘national energy emergency’
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- Donald Trump declares a 'national energy emergency' to accelerate fossil fuel infrastructure development.
- This move marks the beginning of his administration's push to boost oil and gas production and reverse climate initiatives from the Biden era.
- Trump promises to refill the US strategic reserves and export energy globally, while aiming to discard the 'Green New Deal' and electric vehicle mandates.
- The Inflation Reduction Act signed by Biden provides $369 billion for climate action, which Trump has pledged to rescind any unspent funds.
- Concerns arise about potential increases in costs for electric vehicles due to Trump's plans to eliminate subsidies introduced by the Biden administration.

items.title: X, Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube sign EU pledge to tackle hate speech
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Meta, Google, TikTok, and X pledged to prevent and remove illegal hate speech on their platforms as part of the European Commission's revised voluntary commitments under the Digital Services Act.
- Signatories including Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, and others committed to transparency in hate speech detection, third-party monitoring, and reviewing at least two-thirds of hate speech reports within 24 hours.
- EU Commissioner Michael McGrath emphasized the threat of hate and polarization to EU values and noted that companies face no penalties for backing out of these voluntary commitments.

items.title: Donald Trump is officially president again
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Donald Trump has been sworn in as the 47th president of the US on January 20, 2025.
- His second term is expected to impact the tech industry significantly, with influences in tariffs, immigration, and regulation.
- Major tech companies have begun to adapt their strategies in light of Trump's return, including changes in company policies and engagement with Trump.
- Key areas of focus include tariffs on China, US surveillance for deportations, climate change efforts, environmental regulation, AI chip export controls, potential antitrust cases, and immigration policy for tech workers.
- Trump plans to sign numerous executive orders on his first afternoon, potentially affecting trade and the TikTok situation.

items.title: Canon’s new app lets you live stream from multiple cameras, just not Canon’s
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Canon has announced a new live streaming app called Live Switcher Mobile for iPhones and iPads.
- The app allows connecting and switching between video feeds from up to three mobile devices.
- Current limitations include 720p video quality, watermarked output, and ads in the interface.
- A paid subscription ($17.99/month) removes ads and watermarks and increases quality to 1080p.
- The app does not currently support Canon's own digital cameras but will in the future.
- It allows streaming to YouTube, Facebook, and other RTMP-compatible platforms, but comment display is limited to YouTube and Facebook.
- Users can switch feeds manually or set automatic intervals for switching.

items.title: A first look at Nvidia’s flagship RTX 5090 compared to the RTX 4090
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Nvidia’s GeForce RTX 5090 Founders Edition graphics card is set to launch later this month.
- The RTX 5090 features a new packaging design with a smaller inner box.
- The card requires a new power adapter and can use existing 12VHPWR cables.
- The RTX 5090 is slimmer than the RTX 4090, designed as a two-slot card instead of three.
- Cooling has been redesigned with double flow-through fans and a revised PCB layout for better airflow.
- The card includes three DisplayPort 2.1b ports and one HDMI 2.1b port, but the ports are flipped.
- The design introduces refined LED lighting and a new darker metal housing color.
- A full review comparing the RTX 5090's performance to the RTX 4090 will follow soon.

items.title: Welcome to the era of gangster tech regulation
items.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
items.summary:
- President Donald Trump takes office amid allegations of widespread corruption and donor influence.
- Major tech figures like Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos are reportedly attending the inauguration, with significant financial contributions to Trump's campaign.
- The crypto industry seeks lenient regulations and favors from the government, such as designating cryptocurrency a national priority.
- The tech industry faces numerous lawsuits, and Trump's administration may selectively enforce antitrust laws.
- Tech executives aim to secure government contracts, especially in defense, with a focus on military investments.
- Potential conflicts between tech giants could arise due to competing interests in government contracts and regulatory outcomes.
- Overall, the situation posits a troubling dynamic where corporate interests increasingly influence government policy, thereby worsening conditions for the average citizen.

items.title: All the rumors about the iPhone Air
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Apple may launch a new model called iPhone 17 Air this fall.
- The iPhone Air is designed to be ultra-thin, potentially around 5.5mm to 6mm thick.
- It will feature a possibly 48-megapixel rear camera and a 24-megapixel front camera.
- The battery will be challenging due to the slim design, with rumors suggesting a battery size of 3,000 to 4,000mAh.
- The display is rumored to use LTPO OLED technology for better refresh rates and power efficiency, with a size of about 6.6 inches.
- Apple plans to use in-house chips for Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and cellular modem.
- Pricing is uncertain, with speculations ranging from below $999 to above $1,299.
- The design aims to enhance sales after previous models underperformed.

items.title: Bluesky and X launch new video feeds amid TikTok uncertainties
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- TikTok faces uncertainty while Bluesky and X enhance video features.
- New video feeds and tabs allow users to discover vertical videos easily.
- Bluesky introduces customizable video feeds targeting specific hashtags like #BookSky.
- X launches a 'Video Tab' for personalized video content across various topics.
- Users may need to refresh the Bluesky app to see the new features.

items.title: Oppo’s next foldable is about as thin as USB-C allows
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Oppo's upcoming Find N5 foldable is as thin as its USB-C port when unfolded.
- Expected rebranding as OnePlus Open 2 for the US market.
- Product manager Zhou Yibao shared images on Weibo highlighting its thickness, claiming it's the thinnest foldable yet, estimated at around 4mm.
- The Find N5's thickness is compared to two Chinese yuan coins and a stack of four ID cards.
- IPX9-rated for water resistance; tested against high-temperature, high-pressure jets.
- Previous model, Find N3, was rebranded as OnePlus Open in the West, and similar marketing is anticipated for the Find N5.
